meanings.sent1: The baby was colickier than usual last night, keeping the whole house awake.
meanings.sent2: The colickier horse was restless and uncomfortable, pacing back and forth in the stable.
meanings.sent3: The colickier kitten meowed loudly, demanding attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The storm grew colickier by the minute, with thunder rumbling and lightning flashing.
meanings.sent5: The colickier pain in his stomach made it hard for him to focus on anything else.

meanings.sent1: The new medication made her feel even colickier than before, causing her to double over in pain.
meanings.sent2: The colickier of the two puppies whined constantly, while the other one slept peacefully.
meanings.sent3: The colickier car in the race struggled to keep up with the rest, sputtering and slowing down.
meanings.sent4: As the night grew colickier, the wind howled louder and the branches creaked ominously.
meanings.sent5: Her headache felt colickier than ever, throbbing relentlessly behind her eyes.
